ygData.msgSnippet: Code-on-demand (e.g. javascript) is part of ReST. The server can send all of the logic required as javascript on initial load, or event-driven as json, or

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: Giving the UI a REST
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=221647988

Code-on-demand (e.g. javascript) is part of ReST.

The server can send all of the logic required as javascript on initial
load, or event-driven as json, or however you want to do it.

You can have as rich as UI as you want, as long as the states are
embedded in representations from the server. No limitations on content
of representation.
